channel.title: Windows Vista Problems?
channel.description: Alright well lately i have been having some annoying problems with windows vista. Such as internet pages wont load when they should (the only way to get them to load is to restart my brows). Also sometimes it wont let me right click. I was wondering if anyone else has a problem similar to this and if they could help me out?

item.title: Windows Vista Problems?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

billygotshot:

so should i just duel boot and use linux as my main os then us windows for games? or just leave windows completely?

Depends on how much you want to play windows games, and which games you play. For the games you play check on http://appdb.winehq.org/ to see how well they run under WINE. I would definitely suggest that you use linux as your main OS however.

Read full topic

item.description:

but that means i have to backup 30 gigs of stuff somewhere lol

item.title: Windows Vista Problems?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Are you running a program called True Transparency? If so, that’s the problem with right clicking. Other than that, I can’t think of any other explanations for why you’re having problems, other than the obvious reason.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Vista Problems?
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

[quote=“Rajae, post:14, topic:178646”]XP is a reasonable choice, unless you want to try something new.

I am correcting myself, I recommend you reformat Vista every month.[/quote]

but that means i have to backup 30 gigs of stuff somewhere lol

@Rajae wrote:

If your Vista installation is at least a year old, then I recommend you reformat.

item.title: Windows Vista Problems?
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

[quote=“ThugLife, post:8, topic:178646”]Not all of them, some run under wine but not very well.
Oh and if you ever, ever decide to go with linux stay away from *buntu.

Anyway about your problem, what browser are you using?[/quote][quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:178646”]I play all sorts of games on linux, that includes many made-for-linux games, as well as windows ones through WINE. You could always leave windows on to play certain games and do everything else with linux.

And have you tried a different browser?[/quote]
i have tried ie and firefox and both have the same problem =\

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Vista Problems?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“billygotshot, post:6, topic:178646”][quote author=Rajae link=topic=239673.msg2033296#msg2033296 date=1202196463]
Don’t use Vista.
[/quote]

i want to use vista.

and i think it was a program i was running… becase the second i closed out of it everything started to work again lol.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 04, 2008, 08:38:33 PM[/size][hr][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=239673.msg2033322#msg2033322 date=1202197056]
I had windows vista problems for about 10 minutes after I got my new laptop, then I got this and fixed them all:

http://kubuntu.org/download.php#latest
[/quote]

also i was wondering can i play games for windows on linux?[/quote]

WastingTimeWithMikeAndAri – 31 Jan 08

Linux has better Windows compatibility than Vista

Don’t Screw With My Games: I have been using Vista for well over a year now (since Beta 1). Of course Vista is slow, its bloated (over 10x the size of XP), aero kills system performance (even…

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Vista Problems?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I play all sorts of games on linux, that includes many made-for-linux games, as well as windows ones through WINE. You could always leave windows on to play certain games and do everything else with linux.

And have you tried a different browser?

i want to use vista.

and i think it was a program i was running… becase the second i closed out of it everything started to work again lol.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 04, 2008, 08:38:33 PM[/size][hr][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=239673.msg2033322#msg2033322 date=1202197056]
I had windows vista problems for about 10 minutes after I got my new laptop, then I got this and fixed them all:

http://kubuntu.org/download.php#latest
[/quote]

also i was wondering can i play games for windows on linux?[/quote]
Linux is better than the entire windows series.
You are able to play windows games with linux. I know you can play Counter Strike with it (or any Steam game for that matter) with an emulator called WINE.

Read full topic
